skillTree.localised_description: No hide nor armour can stand against the piercing fury of a Dryad or Tree Kin's savage limbs.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10 for Tree Kin units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hewn from the same forest that surrounds them, Tree Kin withstand attacks like the forest withstands the fury of the seasons.

effects.description:
Ward save: 20% for Tree Kin units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The wild beasts of the forest always sense the emotions of the Treemen, empathising with their pain over eons of loss.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +6 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though the wargrove’s Elves remain under the enchanted delusion that they fight for their queen, the spell’s debilitations have been overcome.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -25% for all Elf units
	(Lord's army)

Replaces the "Glamoured" passive ability with "Insidious Glamour" for all Elf units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord embodies the forest; as a result of this, their warriors feel a greater call to defend it.
The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
Those who adopt the oak’s warlike aspect typically stand on the front line, such is the sheer structural strength of its genus.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Wherever winter retreats, the birch is amongst the first to sprout forth, for its vibrance is its greatest strength.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +15 for Dryads, Tree Kin and Treemen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Once the willow’s warlike aspect is adopted, branches and leaves droop and overlap, absorbing anything that may cause harm.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

effects.description:
Speed: +6% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +9% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

effects.description:
Armour: +6 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 3% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 6% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for Hawk Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Hawk Riders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Glade Riders, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Mirthfully looming out from their host, Terrors take on their most fearsome aspect to dampen the spirits of their horrified prey.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -5
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Unleashed upon a foe, these aggressive manifestations of the forest are utilised for their needle-like arrows that inflict painful wounds from afar.
The Despairs are among the most feared Spites within Athel Loren, their arrival always foretelling imminent death.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strikes any combatants in its path

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Scurrying over their host with feverish abandon, Netlings snag the weapons of enemies that come too close with webs of magical filaments.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The staring eyes and tattered wings of tiny, glowing Elves befuddle enemy minds, sending them into a sleep-like trance.
Radiants are sponges for magical energy, manifesting as little more than blurred shapes of pure light that beckon the Winds to their host.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic cost: +15% for all enemy spells
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Hiding in their hosts' hollows are fiendish forms, ready to strike out at any who draw near.
Shrikes take on various frightening forms, moving like quicksilver to target the eyes, and even enter foes’ bodies to attack their very minds.
Bounding from branch to bow, the Luminescents’ magical spoors alight upon allies’ weapons to bestow a minor but lethal enchantment.

effects.description:
Spell resistance: -25%
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: This activates a passive ability used only for the Azazel Daemonblade quest battle

enabled_if: No enemy presence in ability range
